TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ProgIdAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Allows the user to specify the ProgID of a class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can apply this attribute to classes.
ProgIDs are automatically generated for a class by combining the namespace with the type name. This can produce an invalid ProgID however, as ProgIDs are limited to 39 characters and can contain no punctuation other than a period. In such case, a ProgID can be manually assigned to the class using ProgIdAttribute.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to apply `ProgIdAttribute` on a class. The application then gets all attributes of `MyClass`, and prints the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ProgIdAttribute.Value%2A> property of `ProgIdAttribute`.
[!code-vb[ProgIdAttribute_Value#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.runtime.interop_4_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ProgIdAttribute_Value#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.interop_4_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[ProgIdAttribute_Value#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.interop_4_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string progId) cil managed

Docs.param: The ProgID to be assigned to the class.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified ProgID.
Gets the ProgID of the class.
